title._content: Matron's diary of the voyage of the 'Fitzjames', 1856-57

description._content: Page 2 - End of first diary entry plus entries for the 21st - 23rd December 1856. Includes bickering between some of the single women and the ship's departure on the 23rd which induced a bout of sea-sickness among the women. ----------------------------------- many very many cannot see that they need it. I cannot induce them as yet to write in Prayer and I am grieved to say that Theft, Lying and Slander prevail most shock ingly – I fear however that a few leads the many How they may get on is impossible to determine yet, 21st I am sorry to say that the same spirit seems to actuate these young women. One person Ester Firman seems particularly marked out as a subject of scandal. She is charged by them with almost every evil. I have not seen much of her yet as she was in the Hospital at the Depot 22nd we sailed this morning and as usual there has been a Quarrel before going to Bed 23 the Ship Began to roll last night about twelve and most of the young women are now sick, they are all afraid of danger which adds to their sufferings I did not go to Bed all night but thank God I am not sea sick, oh how subdued those turbulent spirits are now they are ill and think themselves in danger they appear to think it a mercy that I am not ill but if they are spared will they then ----------------------------------- You can access the diary on our website here and read a full transcript here. Rights: www.records.nsw.gov.au/about-us/rights-and-permissions We'd love to hear from you if you use our photos.
